intro: Sphalmanthus tenuiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered sphalmanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with a distinctive spurred structure at the base of the petals. Sphalmanthus tenuiflorus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along riverbanks.
